pr_title: KAFKA-10167: use the admin client to read end-offset

timeline.author: mjsax

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need this distinction? Seems we set adminClient in any case and it should never be null?
timeline.author: mjsax

replies.bodyText: I also do not understand the distinction. When would we want to call restoreConsumer.endOffsets(partitions)?
replies.author: cadonna

replies.bodyText: req: Could you add a test (or adapt an existing one) and verify whether during restore() a call to adminClient.listOffsets() with isolation level READ_UNCOMMITTED is done?
replies.author: cadonna

replies.bodyText:
This is just a hack-around: I will always use admin-client by passing it via the constructor.
I will add a unit test.
replies.author: guozhangwang

replies.bodyText: Should we remove this check then?
replies.author: abbccdda

replies.bodyText:
I think we can remove this null check? If you really want to add one, add it to the constructor?
this.adminClient = Objects.notNull(adminClient);
replies.author: mjsax

replies.bodyText: I just saw that we kinda need to pass null as AdminClient in TDD -- however, StoreChangelogReader#restore() is never called by TTD, and thus I still think we should remove the null check and fail hard with a NPE as it would indicate a bug if adminClient is null in a regular deployment.
replies.author: mjsax

timeline.bodyText: Why is adminClient not final any longer? We still pass it into the StreamThread constructor.
timeline.author: mjsax

replies.bodyText:
You mean private, right? It is not private anymore.
Instead of making the adminClient field package private for testing, I would either add a setter setAdmin() to MockClientSupplier or instantiate the admin in a private field of the MockClientSupplier and use the existing getter to set up the admin, or instantiate the admin in a public field of the MockClientSupplier and accessing it directly to set it up (similarly to the producer and consumer).
replies.author: cadonna

replies.bodyText: Yeah I agree, will move all these variables to private and add getters.
replies.author: guozhangwang

timeline.bodyText: Q: Why do you not pass the admin client in the constructor?
timeline.author: cadonna

replies.bodyText: Yeah that's the plan, I was just hacking it around so that I do not need to change 30+ unit tests. Once it is confirmed to fix the issue I will refactor this PR.
